commentary: (NIDD2 2.8) accutan'ti niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhamman'ti
(VIN 1.4.6) acchinnacīvaro nāma bhikkhussa cīvaraṃ acchinnaṃ hoti rājūhi vā corehi vā dhuttehi vā, yehi kehici vā acchinnaṃ hoti.
(MNa) na aññā'ti jānan'atthāya cittaṃ na upaṭṭhapenti.
(ANa) atilīnan’ti atisithilaṃ.
(NIDD1) attā'ti attānudiṭṭhi n'atthi. nirattā'ti ucchedadiṭṭhi n'atthi. attā'ti gahitaṃ n'atthi. nirattā'ti muñcitabbaṃ n'atthi.
(DNa) diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikatthasannissitam'eva katvā vadatī'ti atthavādī
(MNa) anupakhajjā'ti anupavisitvā.
(SNa) anupavajjan’ti appavattikaṃ appaṭisandhikaṃ.
(SNa) appattamānaso'ti appattārahatto
(ITIa) patissato'ti kammaṭṭhānaṃ phātiṃ, gametuṃ samatthāya satiyā patissato satokārī.
(ANa) nābhāsamānan'ti na akathentaṃ.
(SNPa) bahun'ābhichanno'ti bahunā rāg'ādikilesajālena abhicchanno. etena ajjhattabandhanaṃ vuttaṃ.
(ANa) amatāya dhātuyā'ti nibbānadhātuyā.
(ANa) amissīkatan’ti kilesā hi ārammaṇena saddhiṃ cittaṃ missaṃ karonti, tesaṃ abhāvā amissīkataṃ.
(SNa) ayosaṅkunā’ti ayasūlena.
(ANa) assāsā'ti avassayā patiṭṭhā.
(SNPa) avītataṇhāse'ti avigatataṇhā.
(DNa) aveccappasādenā’ti acalappasādena
(KNa) paññāya ajjhogāhetvā
(Sna) āgatigati na hotī’ti paṭisandhivasena āgati nāma, cutivasena gamanaṃ nāma na hoti.
(ANa) āneñjappattan’ti acalappattaṃ.
(ANa) ālimpeyyā'ti tattha aṅgāre pakkhipitvā aggiṃ datvā nāḷikāya dhamanto aggiṃ gāhāpeyya.  (VISMa) ālimpetī'ti ādīpeti jāleti.
(VIN 2.1.36) āsādan'āpekkho'ti iminā imaṃ codessāmi sāressāmi paṭicodessāmi paṭisāressāmi maṅku karissāmī'ti
(BDN) directing of the mind towards the object, initial attention
(SNPa) icchānidānāti taṇhāhetukā.
(MNa) iṭṭhānan’ti pariyesitānaṃ.
(KNa) tattha dānapāramiyaṃ tāva bāhirabhaṇḍapariccāgo pāramī nāma, aṅgapariccāgo upapāramī nāma, jīvitapariccāgo paramatthapāramī nāmā’ti.
(ANa) uparūpari caṅkamatī’ti matthaka-matthake caṅkamati.
(ANa) upavajjan’ti upavād’ārahaṃ.
(SNa) odanakummāsūpacayassā’ti odanena ceva kummāsena ca upacitassa vaḍḍhitassa.
(SNa) kaṭasī'ti susānaṃ
(MNa) kammaṃ etesaṃ paṭisaraṇaṃ patiṭṭhā'ti kammapaṭisaraṇā.
(NIDD1) kāmaguṇā. cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā; saddā... gandhā... rasā... phoṭṭhabbā...
(NIDD I) kāmayānassā'ti kāme icchamānassa sādiyamānassa patthayamānassa pihayamānassa abhijappamānassa.
(SNa) kalikañ'ca kho ahaṃ, āvuso'ti ahaṃ kho, āvuso, kālikaṃ kāmaṃ hitvā sandiṭṭhikaṃ lokuttaradhammaṃ anudhāvāmi.
(SNPa) tasmā munī n'atthi khilo kuhiñcī'ti tena kāraṇena ayaṃ muni rāg'ādikhilehi n'atthi khilo kuhiñcī'ti veditabbo.
(NIDD2 2.8) caran'ti caranto viharanto iriyanto vattento pālento yapento yāpento'ti

(KNa) ñattan'ti jānanasabhāvo. yaṃ sippaṃ jānāti, yamhi vā issariye yase sampattiyañca ṭhito janena ñāyati, pākaṭo paññāto hoti, tassetaṃ nāmaṃ. sippaṃ vā hi issariyādibhāvo vā bālassa anatthāyeva jāyati.
(MNa) somanassaṭṭhāniyan’ti somanassassa ārammaṇavasena kāraṇabhūtaṃ.
(ANa) thalaṭṭhassā’ti ekamante ṭhitassa.
(VINa) das'āhaparaman'ti dasa ahāni paramo paricchedo assā'ti das'āhaparamo
(UDa) tattha diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattan’ti rūp’āyatane cakkhuviññāṇena diṭṭhamattaṃ.
(SNPa) diṭṭhīnivesā'ti idaṃsacc'ābhinivesasaṅkhātāni diṭṭhinivesanāni.
(SNa) nappajahatī’ti chandarāgappahānena na pajahati.
(PTS) for āsasāna: either grd. for *āsaṃsāna or contracted form of ppr. med. of āsaṃsati (= āsiṃsati) for *asaṃsamāna

(Abh Vibh 6.3) cakkh’ādīnaṃ vatthūnaṃ rūp’ādīnaṃ ārammaṇānañ’ca paṭighātena samuppannā saññā paṭighasaññā. rūpasaññ’ādīnaṃ etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. rūpasaññā saddasaññā gandhasaññā rasasaññā phoṭṭhabbasaññā, imā vuccanti paṭighasaññāyo’ti
(ANa) paṇavenā’ti vajjhabheriyā.
(KV) yadi saṅghassa pattakallanti ettha patto kālo imassa kammassāti pattakālaṃ, pattakālameva pattakallaṃ.
(KNa) tapparāyaṇā’ti vivekaparāyaṇā vivekapoṇā.
(VIN 1.2.4) paricareyyā'ti abhirameyya.
(SNPa) pariyesan'ādi'm'anuyuttattā pasutā
(KV) tattha pātimokkhanti paatimokkhaṃ atipamokkhaṃ atiseṭṭhaṃ atiuttamanti attho.
(ANa) puṭaṃsenāti’pi pāṭho. tassattho — puṭo aṃse assāti puṭaṃso, tena puṭaṃsena, aṃsena pātheyyapuṭaṃ vahantenā’pī’ti
(SNPa) pariphandamānan'ti ito c'ito ca phandamānaṃ.
(ANa) bhāsaye'ti obhāseyya.
(SNPa) maccumukhe lapantī'ti antakāle sampatte maraṇamukhe paridevanti.
(MNa) atthi majjhimā paṭipadāti maggaṃ sandhāya idaṃ vuttaṃ. maggo hi lobho eko anto, doso eko antoti ete dve ante na upeti, na upagacchati, vimutto etehi antehi, tasmā “majjhimā paṭipadā”ti vuccati.
(ANa) madhubhāṇī'ti yo madhu viya madhurakathaṃ katheti.
(THa) manussabhūtan'ti manussesu bhūtaṃ, nibbattaṃ, manussattabhāvaṃ vā pattaṃ.
(MNa) manopavicārā’ti vitakkavicārā. vitakkuppādakañhi mano idha manoti adhippetaṃ, manassa upavicārāti manopavicārā.
(SNPa) mamāyite'ti taṇhādiṭṭhimamattehi “maman”ti pariggahite vatthusmiṃ.
(VINa) bhikkhumānattāyā'ti bhikkhūnaṃ mānanabhāvāya, ārādhanatthāyā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
(SNa) paṭimukka’ssa mārapāso’ti assa gīvāya mārapāso paṭimukko pavesito.
(VIN 2.5.1.1) mutaṃ nāma ghānena ghāyitaṃ, jivhāya sāyitaṃ, kāyena phuṭṭhaṃ.
(SNa) ānako'ti evaṃladdhanāmo mudiṅgo. himavante kira mahākuḷīradaho ahosi.
(SNPa) mohanaṃ vuccati kāmaguṇā. ettha hi devamanussā muyhanti, tesu ajjhogāḷho hutvā. etena bahiddhābandhanaṃ vuttaṃ.
ruccittha - aor reflx 3rd sg
(SNa) yathā yāgum’eva yāguttāya, pūvam’eva pūvattāya pacati

(ANa) lahukena asanenā'ti anto susiraṃ katvā tūl'ādīhi pūretvā katalakkhaparikammena sallahukakaṇḍena. evaṃ katañ'hi ekausabhagāmī dve usabhānipi gacchati ... aṭṭhusabhagāmī soḷasa usabhāni'pi gacchati.
(SNa) mātugāma-vasena sagāhaṃ sarakkhasaṃ.
(ANa) saṃkilesikehī'ti saṃkilesanakehi, pasannassa cittassa pasannabhāvadūsakehī'ti attho.
(SNa) yathā yāgum’eva yāguttāya, pūvam’eva pūvattāya pacati
(ANa) sañjagghatī’ti hasitakathaṃ katheti.
(SNa) yathā yāgum’eva yāguttāya, pūvam’eva pūvattāya pacati
(SNPa) satto'ti laggo. guhāyan'ti kāye. kāyo hi rāg'ādīnaṃ vāḷānaṃ vasan'okāsato “guhā”ti vuccati.
(Ñāṇananda) “propitiates”. It is likely that the two words imply two functions of the ritual associated with incense. While some fragrant kinds of incense are used for propitiating benevolent spirits
(MNa) na sannāmetī'ti obaddhānābaddhaṭṭhānehi pādaṃ koṭṭento viya na thaddhaṃ karoti.
(ANa) sabhaggato'ti sabhāya ṭhito.
(ANa) na sampavedheyyā’ti vedhetvā pavedhetvā pātetuṃ na sakkuṇeyya.
(ANa) saravatī’ti sarasampannā.
(MNa) sallekho'ti ca idha avihiṃsā'va veditabbā. avihiṃsā hi vihiṃsaṃ sallekhati, taṃ chindati, tasmā sallekho'ti vuccati. esa nayo sabbattha. ayaṃ pana viseso.
(DHPa) sārade'ti saradakāle vāt'ātapapahatāni tattha tattha vippakiṇṇālābūni viya.
(SNa) kāmaguṇa-vasena sāvaṭṭaṃ.
(ANa) sīsacchejjan’ti sīsacched’ārahaṃ.
(MNa) somanassaṭṭhāniyan’ti somanassassa ārammaṇavasena kāraṇabhūtaṃ.
(KNa) paṭhamaṃ uppannaṃ kilesā pacchā uppajjanakānaṃ kāraṇabhāvato kilesāva kilesavatthūni
(ANa) vayañ’c’ass’ānupassatī’ti tassa cesa cittassa uppādam’pi vayam’pi passati.
(SNa) yathā yāgum’eva yāguttāya, pūvam’eva pūvattāya pacati
(MNa) idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, ayaṃ vitakko kiṃ hetu kiṃ paccayā kiṃ kāraṇā uppanno’ti vitakkānaṃ mūlañ’ca mūlamūlañ’ca manasikātabban’ti.
(NIDD2 2.8) yaṃ viditvā sato caran'ti yaṃ viditaṃ katvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṃ katvā.
(Ñāṇananda) “exorcises” It is likely that the two words imply two functions of the ritual associated with incense... certain caustic types are utilized for exorcising evil spirits.
(bsk): perplexity, mental disturbance, annoyance, perturbation
(NIDD1) visaññasaññino vuccanti ummattakā ye ca khittacittā, na'pi so ummattako, no'pi khittacitto'ti
(SNa) yathā yāgum’eva yāguttāya, pūvam’eva pūvattāya pacati
(DHPa) api cettha ajjhattasamuṭṭhānā hirī, bahiddhāsamuṭṭhānaṃ ottappaṃ.
